data.text:
Last month, White & Case participated in Diversity Lab’s 2024 “Movements to Movements Hackathon,” hosted at the NYU School of Law. More than 100 legal department leaders, law firm partners, and Diversity & Inclusion experts joined forces to pitch innovative D&I programs. The "Shark Tank” inspired competition challenged participants to develop sustainable and scalable solutions to strengthen D&I across the legal profession, while also ensuring fair and equal access to high-quality work, sponsors and other opportunities for all talent. White & Case partner Caroline Miller Smith contributed as a key member of the “Career Catalyst” team, which designed a program bridging mentorship and sponsorship. The initiative pairs high-potential mid-level lawyers with experienced in-house counsel leaders, providing them with structured support, advocacy, and exposure to senior leaders. The “Career Catalyst” team received an honorable mention, and their program will be further developed and piloted alongside other winning solutions in participating organizations. Congratulations to all the winners and everyone who participated! #TogetherWeMakeAMark #DEI #Hackathon

"[AI] is not like the computer HAL in '2001: A Space Odyssey' that is literally doing everything." White & Case partner Joel Cohen discusses the US Department of Justice's enforcement efforts in the Artificial Intelligence sector with Law360, and how misunderstandings of the technology can lead to investigations. Read more here: https://whcs.law/46QPEtx #whitecase #AI #DOJ

“We encourage everyone who joins the Firm to join as many of our affinity networks as possible and to really leverage them as a space to learn more about the lived experience of others.” On this episode of On the Record with White & Case, we're joined by Hedieh Fakhriyazdi, Chief Diversity Officer based in our New York office. Hedieh shares insights around her culture, identity and journey as an Iranian-American whilst also discussing how our affinity networks help the Firm learn what it can do to advance those underrepresented communities more effectively. Tune in to this episode on one of your favorite podcast platforms including Apple Podcasts, Google Podcasts and Spotify, or listen here: https://whcs.law/3tVDAF2 #TogetherWeMakeAMark

In our “Leaders in Water” video series, we explore the crucial challenge of water security with leading water industry experts from across the globe. In the latest conversation, Lihy Teuerstein, COO of IDE Water Assets, shares her thoughts on governments’ role in aggregating water facilities and offering incentives for water project investment, as well as how technological advances can assist in the development and operation of water facilities. Watch the full conversation here: https://whcs.law/4c8Ua7o #watersecurity #AI #technology #infrastructure #innovation
